sub_topic: Show that every group of order 16 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C16, the dihedral group D8, or the non-abelian group of order 16.
message_1: How many distinct groups of order 16 are there up to isomorphism?
message_2:
There are 14 distinct groups of order 16 up to isomorphism. These groups can be classified as follows:

1. Cyclic group: C_16
2. Direct product of two cyclic groups: C_8 × C_2
3. Direct product of four cyclic groups: C_4 × C_2 × C_2
4. Direct product of two cyclic groups: C_4 × C_4
5. Direct product of two cyclic groups: C_2 × C_2 × C_2 × C_2
6. Semidirect product of C_8 and C_2: C_8 ⋊ C_2
7. Semidirect product of C_4 × C_2 and C_2: (C_4 × C_2) ⋊ C_2
8. Semidirect product of C_4 × C_2 and C_2: (C_4 × C_2) ⋊ C_2 (different from 7)
9. Semidirect product of C_4 × C_4 and C_2: (C_4 × C_4) ⋊ C_2
10. Semidirect product of C_4 × C_4 and C_2: (C_4 × C_4) ⋊ C_2 (different from 9)
11. Semidirect product of C_2 × C_2 × C_2 and C_2: (C_2 × C_2 × C_2) ⋊ C_2
12. Semidirect product of C_2 × C_2 × C_2 and C_2: (C_2 × C_2 × C_2) ⋊ C_2 (different from 11)
13. Semidirect product of C_2 × C_2 × C_2 and C_2: (C_2 × C_2 × C_2) ⋊ C_2 (different from 11 and 12)
14. Quaternion group of order 16: Q_16

These are all the distinct groups of order 16 up to isomorphism.
